title: Why Apple Stock Climbed Today
text: CEO Tim Cook expects the tech giant's revenue growth to "accelerate."

title: Apple, Amazon & Big Tech Showcase Their Earnings Power Once Again
text: No company is completely immune from cyclical forces.

title: What Recession? 5 Stocks Leading the Nasdaq to Its Best Month Since 2020
text: Amazon and Apple reported solid earnings Friday, and a rally among small- and mid-cap tech stocks and clean energy players has the Nasdaq up by more than 10% in July.

title: Big Tech's Reign Isn't Over Yet
text: Earnings season has offered a reminder about the value of tech. Why Amazon, Alphabet, and Microsoft remain strong buys.

title: Apple: $3 Trillion Is Within Reach Again
text: Despite stronger-than-expected fiscal Q3 results and positive commentary on Apple's forward outlook, management continues to caution against the "cocktail of headwinds" facing the business that remains in flux. However, the company's robust results have also demonstrated that management's positive view of upcoming quarters' performance did not come lightly.

title: Apple Posts Record Revenues, Beats on Earnings: ETFs to Buy
text: Apple beat the estimates on both the top and bottom lines and posted record quarterly revenues.

title: Good Stocks To Buy Right Now? 3 Growth Stocks For Your Watchlist
text: Are these growth stocks the best stocks to buy right now?

title: Apple Had a Strong Quarter. 5 Reasons to Buy the Stock.
text: Analysts are optimistic following the tech giant's third-quarter earnings. Citi outlines five reasons the tech giant is a buy.

title: Why Apple Shares May Have Room to Move Higher After Earnings
text: Apple's solid earnings report is showing that in terms of the company's iPhone, what consumers do may be more important than what they say

title: AAPL Stock Powers Up as Apple Demonstrates Resilience
text: Apple (NASDAQ: AAPL ) stock rose 3% overnight after analysts concluded its quarterly results showed “resilience.” Apple earned $19.4 billion, $1.20 per share, on revenue of $83 billion for the three months ending in June.

title: The online ad market is in decline and it's dragging down tech giants with it
text: Much of contemporary Silicon Valley was built on advertising dollars. That dependence made even the most powerful companies look at least somewhat vulnerable this week after reporting their latest earnings results.

title: Is Apple Stock A Sell After Recent Price Target Cuts?
text: Apple delivers another quarter of resilient services revenue growth, strong cash flows, and share repurchases. Services revenues make up around 20% of the overall picture but that figure should increase over time.

title: Apple and Amazon Earnings Add More Fuel to Growth Stocks' Fire
text: Source: eamesBot / Shutterstock The stock market is in major rebound mode, and we think there are some even bigger gains on the horizon . Since mid-June, the S&P 500 is up 11% – an impressive gain for a market that's been crushed all year long.

title: Apple (AAPL) Q3 Earnings Top Estimates, Revenues Increase Y/Y
text: Apple's (AAPL) third-quarter fiscal 2022 results reflect steady demand for iPhone 13 and continued momentum in Services segments.

title: Apple Stock Nears Buy Point After 'Top Gun'-Style June Quarter
text: Apple stock rose Friday after the consumer electronics giant delivered an upbeat June-quarter report and forecast accelerating sales growth. The post Apple Stock Nears Buy Point After 'Top Gun'-Style June Quarter appeared first on Investor's Business Daily.

title: Chevron, Apple stocks' 57-point contribution to the Dow is offset by P&G, Intel drags
text: Shares of Chevron Corp. CVX, +0.76% rallied 3.0% to pace the Dow Jones Industrial Average's DJIA, +1.03% premarket gainers after blow-out second-quarter earnings, while Apple Inc.'s stock AAPL, +0.36% was second with a 2.7% jump, also after better-than-expected earnings. The implied price gains would had a combined 57 points to the Dow's price, while Dow futures YM00, +0.00% inched down 2 points.

title: Apple Loses Steam, but iPhone Demand Remains Strong -- Is the Stock a Buy?
text: The latest quarter beat Wall Street's expectations, but don't get too excited just yet.

title: Amazon, Apple, Google and Tesla have all done it. Here's why companies split their stock
text: A stock split is not uncommon for big names like Amazon, Apple and Tesla. CNBC's Emily Lorsch explains what happens when a company splits its stock.

title: Nasdaq futures surge as Apple, Amazon hold out against weak consumer spending
text: U.S. stocks futures gained led by the Nasdaq on Friday as positive forecasts from Apple and Amazon indicated resilience in mega-cap companies in the face of weaker consumer spending, with hopes of a less aggressive monetary policy boosting sentiment.

title: Apple earnings can be summed up in one word
text: Apple Inc.'s iPhone business looks to be a portrait of resilience, according to numerous analysts, as the company indicated late Thursday that macroeconomic pressures had yet to dampen demand for its smartphones.

title: Cut Yearly Expenses By $2,000, Boost IRA Savings By $140,000
text: Want to save more for retirement? You can. Experts explain ways to ax chunks of your expenses and funnel the savings into retirement accounts.

title: Apple and Amazon's Tech Strength Gets Bulls Buying Despite Recession on the Radar
text: Recession, what recession? Apple and Amazon.com reported results after the latest Federal Reserve decision, but their results fit with Chair Jerome Powell's declaration that too many areas of the U.S. economy were performing too well for recession to have begun—a day before Commerce Department data suggested that, by some measures, it had.

title: 80% of Warren Buffett's Portfolio Is Invested in These 7 Stocks
text: Diversification isn't necessary if you know what you're doing, according to the Oracle of Omaha.

title: Stock futures boosted by jumps for Apple and Amazon after earnings
text: U.S. stock futures rose on Friday after Wall Street welcomed Amazon and Apple earnings amid hopes for a slower pace of Fed tightening.

title: Stock Gains for Apple and Amazon Lift All of Big Tech
text: Apple and Amazon are rising after quarterly results, giving a lift to shares of other tech giants, such as Microsoft and Alphabet.

title: Apple: Another Earnings Beat, On Track For A Record-Breaking Year
text: Apple, Inc. is on track to deliver close to $100 billion of net income in the fiscal year 2022 and set a new company record, which should help it move higher. AAPL has now returned $686 billion of capital to shareholders through buybacks and dividends, and in Q3 AAPL repurchased roughly $350 million worth of shares daily.
